body.p:
Frankfort Ky May 20, 1865
To the Governor:
A. Craig respectfully states:

John Hancock was on the 15 Jan'y 1865 fined ten dollars and costs ^in each of two cases.^ on the Police Court of Frankfort for disorder, and to prevent him from going to jail I became his surety. The fine disorder was the result of drinking, but since the fine Hancock has been orderly and soberly. Hancock is a laborer, and has no property subject to execution, and unless the fine is remitted, I will have to pay it. Hancocks drinking was accidental, and ever since these fines has been attending to his business, & I believe will behave in the future.

I respectfully ask for a remission
A Craig
We unite in the petition for the remission

James Harlan jr
Thos Rodman
R W Blackburn
J. Swigert
John R Graham
S C Buell
A H Rennick
John Macklin
D. W. Macy

Police Ct of Frankfort
vs
John Hancock
$10. each
20th May 1865
